title: Star vampire

* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* is neither male nor female.
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* can [follow](/wiki/Follower "Follower") you to other levels.
* is [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless").
* is a [vampire](/wiki/Vampire "Vampire").
* may [turn against you](/wiki/Treachery "Treachery") when tame. |                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |                                                                                                                                                                                                                              |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      | [SLASH'EM\_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line3232](/wiki/SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line3232 "SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c")                                                                                                             |

A **star vampire** is a [Lovecraftian](/wiki/H.P._Lovecraft "H.P. Lovecraft") monster encountered in the [Lethe patch](/wiki/Lethe_patch "Lethe patch") and [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)
- [2 Messages](#Messages)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 Origin](#Origin)
- [5 Encyclopedia Entry](#Encyclopedia_Entry)

## Description

Star vampires possesses six tentacle attacks, three of which can [drain life](/wiki/Drain_life "Drain life"). They are very fast, have excellent base [AC](/wiki/AC "AC"), and are always generated [invisible](/wiki/Invisible "Invisible")

Although represented by the [V](/wiki/V "V") glyph, star vampires are not actually undead, and thus are not immune to attacks such as [drain life](/wiki/Drain_life "Drain life") and [death rays](/wiki/Death_ray "Death ray"), as proper vampires are.

## Messages

The star vampire is the only monster besides the [(master) mind flayer](/wiki/Mind_flayer "Mind flayer") to have a tentacle attack. The message one sees when attacked is "The star vampire's tentacles suck you!" One should note that although this is the same message as the mind flayer, the star vampire does not eat your brain; its attacks 'merely' do physical damage and possibly [level drain](/wiki/Level_drain "Level drain"). One should also note that, unlike the mind flayer, a [ring of free action](/wiki/Ring_of_free_action "Ring of free action") does not protect you against the star vampire's attacks, like it does protect against mind flayer attacks in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM").

## Strategy

Due to their speed and high number of attacks, star vampires can dish out incredible amounts of physical damage, particularly to characters with poor AC. Because of this, one should always seek to destroy them alone if possible, and if surrounded, keep in mind they do respect [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth"). [Magic cancellation](/wiki/Magic_cancellation "Magic cancellation") or [drain resistance](/wiki/Drain_resistance "Drain resistance") is a must to protect against their draining attacks, although this should not be a problem by the time one encounters them.

Be mindful of fighting [petrifying](/wiki/Petrify "Petrify") monsters around star vampires. They will cause the game to spam you with anywhere from six to nine messages per turn, depending on your speed, making it quite easy to miss the vital "You are slowing down" and "Your limbs are stiffening" messages.

If you have [polymorph control](/wiki/Polymorph_control "Polymorph control"), the star vampire makes an excellent polymorph form because of the same qualities that make it a fearsome opponent: a high base level, flight, speed, regeneration, flying, unbreathing, and the ability to wear most kinds of armor, not to mention powerful attacks. Star vampires cannot get [magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") from a cloak or dragon scale mail, however, so players should take appropriate precautions or ensure another source ([Magicbane](/wiki/Magicbane "Magicbane"), a [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact"), etc.)

## Origin

The star vampire is a monster from the Cthulhu Mythos, though not one created by Lovecraft. Star vampire are extraterrestrials that lack a specific shape and have a myriad of sucker tentacles. Though they also feed on blood, they are not to be confused with the usual undead vampires.

## Encyclopedia Entry

A creature from beyond the stars. Invisible, it floats along until it finds something to feed upon and then draws its life energy and blood into itself. It is said that they become briefly visible just after they have eaten and that this is such a terrible sight it can drive a mortal insane.

Wikipedia has an article about:
Star vampire
V star vampire
Difficulty 28
Attacks Tentacles 2d6, Tentacles 2d6 drain life, Tentacles 2d6, Tentacles 2d6 drain life, Tentacles 2d6, Tentacles 2d6 drain life
V star vampire
Difficulty 28
Attacks

Tentacles 2d6, Tentacles 2d6 drain life, Tentacles 2d6, Tentacles 2d6 drain life, Tentacles 2d6, Tentacles 2d6 drain life

Base level 18
Base experience 750
Speed 18
Base AC -5
Base MR 60
Alignment -5 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size Large
Resistances sleep, poison, cold
Resistances conveyed None

A star vampire:

  • can fly.
  • does not breathe.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • regenerates HP quickly.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is neither male nor female.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • never leaves a corpse.
  • is a vampire.
  • may turn against you when tame.
Reference SLASH'EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line3232

A star vampire is a Lovecraftian monster encountered in the Lethe patch and SLASH'EM.

Contents

  • 1 Description
  • 2 Messages
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 Origin
  • 5 Encyclopedia Entry

Description

Star vampires possesses six tentacle attacks, three of which can drain life. They are very fast, have excellent base AC, and are always generated invisible

Although represented by the V glyph, star vampires are not actually undead, and thus are not immune to attacks such as drain life and death rays, as proper vampires are.

Messages

The star vampire is the only monster besides the (master) mind flayer to have a tentacle attack. The message one sees when attacked is "The star vampire's tentacles suck you!" One should note that although this is the same message as the mind flayer, the star vampire does not eat your brain; its attacks 'merely' do physical damage and possibly level drain. One should also note that, unlike the mind flayer, a ring of free action does not protect you against the star vampire's attacks, like it does protect against mind flayer attacks in SLASH'EM.

Strategy

Due to their speed and high number of attacks, star vampires can dish out incredible amounts of physical damage, particularly to characters with poor AC. Because of this, one should always seek to destroy them alone if possible, and if surrounded, keep in mind they do respect Elbereth. Magic cancellation or drain resistance is a must to protect against their draining attacks, although this should not be a problem by the time one encounters them.

Be mindful of fighting petrifying monsters around star vampires. They will cause the game to spam you with anywhere from six to nine messages per turn, depending on your speed, making it quite easy to miss the vital "You are slowing down" and "Your limbs are stiffening" messages.

If you have polymorph control, the star vampire makes an excellent polymorph form because of the same qualities that make it a fearsome opponent: a high base level, flight, speed, regeneration, flying, unbreathing, and the ability to wear most kinds of armor, not to mention powerful attacks. Star vampires cannot get magic resistance from a cloak or dragon scale mail, however, so players should take appropriate precautions or ensure another source (Magicbane, a quest artifact, etc.)

Origin

The star vampire is a monster from the Cthulhu Mythos, though not one created by Lovecraft. Star vampire are extraterrestrials that lack a specific shape and have a myriad of sucker tentacles. Though they also feed on blood, they are not to be confused with the usual undead vampires.

Encyclopedia Entry

A creature from beyond the stars. Invisible, it floats along until it finds something to feed upon and then draws its life energy and blood into itself. It is said that they become briefly visible just after they have eaten and that this is such a terrible sight it can drive a mortal insane.

A '''star vampire''' is a [[H.P. Lovecraft|Lovecraftian]] monster encountered in the [[Lethe patch]] and [[SLASH'EM]]. 
==Description==
Star vampires possesses six tentacle attacks, three of which can [[drain life]].  They are very fast, have excellent base [[AC]], and are always generated [[invisible]]

Although represented by the [[V]] glyph, star vampires are not actually undead, and thus are not immune to attacks such as [[drain life]] and [[death ray]]s, as proper vampires are.
==Messages==
The star vampire is the only monster besides the [[mind flayer|(master) mind flayer]] to have a tentacle attack. The message one sees when attacked is "The star vampire's tentacles suck you!" One should note that although this is the same message as the mind flayer, the star vampire does not eat your brain; its attacks 'merely' do physical damage and possibly [[level drain]]. One should also note that, unlike the mind flayer, a [[ring of free action]] does not protect you against the star vampire's attacks, like it does protect against mind flayer attacks in [[SLASH'EM]].

==Strategy==
Due to their speed and high number of attacks, star vampires can dish out incredible amounts of physical damage, particularly to characters with poor AC. Because of this, one should always seek to destroy them alone if possible, and if surrounded, keep in mind they do respect [[Elbereth]]. [[Magic cancellation]] or [[drain resistance]] is a must to protect against their draining attacks, although this should not be a problem by the time one encounters them.

Be mindful of fighting [[petrify]]ing monsters around star vampires.  They will cause the game to spam you with anywhere from six to nine messages per turn, depending on your speed, making it quite easy to miss the vital "You are slowing down" and "Your limbs are stiffening" messages.

If you have [[polymorph control]], the star vampire makes an excellent polymorph form because of the same qualities that make it a fearsome opponent: a high base level, flight, speed, regeneration, flying, unbreathing, and the ability to wear most kinds of armor, not to mention powerful attacks. Star vampires cannot get [[magic resistance]] from a cloak or dragon scale mail, however, so players should take appropriate precautions or ensure another source ([[Magicbane]], a [[quest artifact]], etc.)

==Origin==
The star vampire is a monster from the Cthulhu Mythos, though not one created by Lovecraft. Star vampire are extraterrestrials that lack a specific shape and have a myriad of sucker tentacles. Though they also feed on blood, they are not to be confused with the usual undead vampires.

==Encyclopedia Entry==
{{encyclopedia|	A creature from beyond the stars. Invisible, it floats along until it finds something to feed upon and then draws its life energy and blood into itself.  It is said that they become briefly visible just after they have eaten and that this is such a terrible sight it can drive a mortal insane.
